oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Royal Crown Cola - 1946-02-16 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Royal Crown Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 16, 1946. Featuring Ernie Keller (announcer), Louie Buck (host) and performers Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalists Cowboy Copas and Becky Barfield, George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers, Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours, the Short Brothers of Jimmy Short and Leon Short (members of the Texas Troubadours), Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet, and Bradley Kincaid. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wally Fowler; Oak Ridge Quartet; Bradley Kincaid; Ernest Tubb; Texas Troubadours; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; Becky Barfield
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Louie Buck and Pee Wee King talk -- Louie Buck introduces Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet -- I's In His Care (Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet) -- Louie Buck introduces Bradley Kincaid -- The Wreck Of The Number Nine (Bradley Kincaid) -- Louie Buck introduces Ernest Tubb -- That's When It's Coming Home To You (Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours) -- Fat salvage P.S.A. (Louie Buck, Ernie Keller) -- Louie Buck introduces Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with Becky Barfield -- I'll Never Let You Worry My Mind Anymore (Becky Barfield, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys) -- Louie Buck and Pee Wee King introduce Redd Stewart and Shorty Boyd -- Ida Red (Redd Stewart fiddle, Shorty Boyd fiddle) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Louie Buck) -- Luden's Cough Drops commercial
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Keller, Ernie; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Copas, Cowboy; Barfield, Becky; Fowler, Wally; Oak Ridge Quartet; Oak Ridge Boys; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Texas Troubadours; Short Brothers (Musical group); Short, Jimmie; Short, Leon; Kincaid, Bradley; Stewart, Redd; Boyd, Shorty
